system.admin_build_oopkickstarter_description: Creation wizard for the OOP modules that will create all the necessary development files to build an OOP module.

labels.settings: General informations The general informations about the module (typically found in the .info file). Name The technical (short) name of the module (directory name). Title The module title, as displayed in the module list. Description The module description, as displayed in the module list. This will also be used to generate the 'help' hook. Package The module's package, used to group the modules in the modules list. CVS/SVN ID Adds the CVS/SVN ID variable in all generated files. Author Informations about the author of the module. Name The name of the author (will be written in the JavaDoc comments). Email The email of the author (will be written in the JavaDoc comments). Dependancies The general requirements for the module. Drupal version The minimum version of Drupal required to use this module. PHP version The minimum version of PHP required to use this module. Dependancies Dependancies on other Drupal modules, as comma separated list (do not include oop). Block Controls the block options for the module. Add block content Wheter the module has block content or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the block content. Description The description of the block content. Configuration Adds configuration options for the block content. Access The access arguments for the block content, as a comma separated list (eg. 'access example content, administer example'). Node Controls the node options for the module. Add node content Wheter the module has node content or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the node content. Description The description of the node content. Access The access arguments for the node content, as a comma separated list (eg. 'create example node, edit own example node'). Admin settings Controls the administration settings options for the module. Add administration settings Wheter the module has an administration settings page or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the administration page. Description The description of the administration page. Settable number of blocks Wether the number of blocks can be set through the administration settings page (only relevant if the module has block content). Menu item Controls the menu items options for the module. Add a menu item Wheter the module has a custom menu item or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Path> The path of the menu item (eg. 'admin/mynode'). Title The title of the menu item. Description The description of the menu item. Access The access arguments for the menu item, as a comma separated list (eg. 'access administration pages, ...'). Filter Controls the filter options for the module. Add filter Wheter the module has a filter or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the filter. Description The description of the filter. Database table Controls the database table options for the module. Add a database table Wheter the module has a custom database table or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Table name The name of the database table (will be automatically prefixed by the module name). Miscellaneous Miscellaneous options for the module. CSS Creates the CSS file for the module. JS Creates the JavaScript file for the module. Writes the module

module.errorNoDir: Error: the modules directory does not exist (path: %s)
module.errorDirNotWriteable: Error: the modules directory is not writeable (path: %s)
module.invalidModuleName: Invalid module name. Only lowercase letters, without special characters or spaces
module.phpVersionTooOld: PHP version needs to be at least 5.0
module.introText: This wizard will let you configure a Drupal module , taking advantage of the OOP Framework. It will generate all the necessary files, depending on the type of module you want. Even if the generated module will be fully functionnal, please remember that this is only a kickstarter, not an editor nor a generator for the module's content. It will only generate the required placholders for your code. So once you have generated your module, please take a look at all the generated files. Happy coding...
